title: Mannlgrat
text:
The Mannlgrat is an east-facing ridge on the "<a href="Hoher%20G%C3%B6ll">Hoher Göll</a>" in the <a href="Bavarian%20Alps">Bavarian Alps</a> rising above <a href="Obersalzberg">Obersalzberg</a> near <a href="Berchtesgaden">Berchtesgaden</a>.
The ridge rises from a <a href="mountain%20pass">col</a> separating it from a subpeak of the Hoher Göll, the "<a href="Kehlstein">Kehlstein</a>", upon which the famous <a href="Kehlsteinhaus">Kehlsteinhaus</a> is located. Served by a <a href="Klettersteig">Klettersteig</a>, the Mannlgrat is regarded as the easiest route to the Hoher Göll's summit.
